thread.title: Huge Huntsman spider handed in at reptile park is 'Australia's biggest'
thread.title_full: Huge Huntsman spider handed in at reptile park is 'Australia's biggest'

author: Jamie Bullen
title: Huge Huntsman spider handed in at reptile park is 'Australia's biggest'
text:
Tuesday 21 February 2017 09:55 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Colossal: Behemoth has been described as Australia's biggest Huntsman The Australian Reptile Park/Facebook 
Australian zookeepers believe a hulking Huntsman spider handed in at a reptile park could be the country’s largest ever. 
Behemoth, a whopping 16cm arachnid, clambered into the Australian Reptile Park in Somersby, New South Wales last week. 
It was introduced amid a drive to have funnel web spiders brought to the park in order to create an antidote against venomous bites. 
And experts described the colossal creature as “Australia’s biggest Huntsman” as video showed it scuttling around on a table and wrapping its eight legs around a tree. 
General manager Tim Faulkner said the species often “get a bad rap” because of their size but were usually harmless to humans.
